The Fringes application¶

This is an application written in Python for fringe pattern analysis. A fringe pattern is a two-dimensional (2D) image that modulates phase information. Its basic model is the following:

\[I(x,y) = a(x,y) + b(x,y)\cos(\phi(x,y))\]

where \(a(x,y)\) is the background illumination, \(b(x,y)\) the constrast or modulation term and \(\phi(x,y)\) is the modulating phase.

Here we present the documentation of modules that conform the Fringes application.

fringes module¶

platform:Unix, Mac OSX
sinopsys:Main module.

This is the main module that executes the fringes program.

fringes.main(argv)¶

Starts the fringes application.

When the application is started, it is shown the graphic user interface

Parameters:argv – argument list passed by user.

gui module¶

platform:Unix, MacOs X
sinopsys:Graphic User interface

This module defined the classes of objects that are used in the user interface.

mainwindow module¶

platform:Unix, MacOS X
sinopsys:Main window.

The main window of the graphic user interface.

The graphic user interface is composed by the following:

  • The menu. It get acces to different commands.
  • The view area. Here it is shown the images that are processed and results.
class gui.mainwindow.MainWindow(parent=None)¶

This is the main window of the user interface.

The user interface interacts with the user. The main window has menus that let user do actions or execute commands. Actions are enabled when the conditions for executing an action are present. For example, you can not apply some kind of process if there is not any data present. This behaivor is implemented by using some kind of a state machine.

The state machine works in the folliwing way: The aplication has states are constrain that enable or disable some actions from the user interface. When an action is executed, it stablishs the state that this action produces. For example, when user execute an action like open file, when the file is opened and its conted loaded the action will produce a data loaded state. This state is a constrains that will enable or disable other actions.

An action is a command to be executed by the user. Then, most actions has a dialog that interacts with the user to set parameters for the command being executed.

User loads data for being processed. When the user loads data, this data is treated as a document. Then, a document represents the data on which the user is working on.

Protected attributes

_state¶

type: Constrains

Has the current state of the application.

_actionDialog¶

type: ActionDialog

Reference to the current action dialog executed.

_doc¶

type: Document

Reference to the current document

MainWindow.__init__(parent=None)¶

Constructs the main window.

Parameters:parent –

The parent window of this main window.

Usually you pass parent=None in most cases.
MainWindow.connectSignals()¶

Connects the signals and slots of user actions.

User actions are accesed usually from a graphic menu. When user selects an action, this actions emits a signal that is catched by an slot. Then, an slot is a function that executes the action.

Author :Julio C. Estrada <julio@cio.mx>
